content:
Implement a D flip-flop with a synchronous reset. When reset (r) is high, set the output (q) to 0 regardless of the input (d). When reset is low, the output (q) should follow the input (d) at the rising edge of the clock (clk).

Retrieved Related Information:
- clk: input clock signal (Type:Signal)
- d: input data signal (Type:Signal)
- r: input reset signal (Type:Signal)
- q: output signal of the D flip flop (Type:Signal)
- When r is low and on the rising edge of clk, q follows d. (Type:StateTransition)
- When r is high, q is reset to 0 regardless of clk and d. (Type:StateTransition)
source: The module should implement a simple D flip flop with active high synchronous reset (reset output to 0).
